channel.title: Is this a good VPS
channel.description:
Note: I posted this in the stickied thread but didnt get any reply..
Hey all, I am getting a VPS soon (it contains 2 worlds, 317&562), needs to hold like 20-30 people (maybe more), what platform should I pick? Windows, Linux, Unix (I have no clue how they, except windows, work), and is this a good deal: (8USD a month) VDS 512 512MB RAM 1 VCPU 15GB SAS Storage 1Gbps Port Speed 500GB Included transfer 10 Free IPV6 1 Free IPV4 SolusVM Semi Managed Instant Setup Windows / Linux / Unix

item.title: Is this a good VPS
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Please keep your VPS questions to the official sticky.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good VPS
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

[quote=“Mountainbit, post:10, topic:424329”]To host two servers?

AT-LEAST 2gb RAM, unlimited bandwith if possible, 3+ghz.[/quote]
Cool, just repost what I said?

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good VPS
item.dc:creator: @aekramer aekramer
item.description:
@aekramer wrote:

Ok thanks all, I think I will start with 1.5GB RAM, Linux, 2GHz CPU, 2TB bandwith/month (I am using Delta and RS2HD) else I would have to pick something too expensive (dont have any donations yet, and few money to spend)

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good VPS
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

[quote=“Mountainbit, post:14, topic:424329”]And if for some odd reason it doesn’t (Maybe off-shore VPS company?) you could easily port forward on it. Its just like another computer. Not just like. It is another computer, that you hve full access to from your computer, (with the companys restrictions set onto the PC of course.)[/quote]which u can easily disable

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good VPS
item.dc:creator: @Mountainbit Mountainbit
item.description:
@Mountainbit wrote:

And if for some odd reason it doesn’t (Maybe off-shore VPS company?) you could easily port forward on it. Its just like another computer. Not just like. It is another computer, that you hve full access to from your computer, (with the companys restrictions set onto the PC of course.)

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good VPS
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

aekramer:

And for 1 server (317), 1GB Ram? Also I never see CPU declared anywhere… Well yeah I am think about it now, but I need to know how I find out if I am able to portforward etc on it?

VPS’s come with all ports open. no need to portforward

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good VPS
item.dc:creator: @Mountainbit Mountainbit
item.description:
@Mountainbit wrote:

Yeah, you’re proabably going to need more RAM than that for the shitty quality of the server.

Unless you’re using Hyperion or Apollo.

item.title: Is this a good VPS
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

[quote=“aekramer, post:5, topic:424329”]I found tons of sites with 1GB ram, 8 pounds etc… What are minimum specs? Because I found another one:

VPS PACKAGE #2
VPS Software: vePortal™ / OpenVZ™
CPU: 1500MHZ GUARANTEED
Memory: 1GB GUARANTEED
Disk Space: 50GB (RAID BASED CONFIG)
Bandwidth: 1000GB/MONTH
IP Addresses: 2 (IPv4) + IPv6
Management: BASIC MANAGED
DDOS Protection: CISCO™ GUARD
FREE SETUP $9.95/MONTH

Its for like 20-30 people… If there are more I would update[/quote]
1st i would say that, the site is scamming. “DDOS Protection” Theres no way to protect against one unless you have several fire walls. 9.95/Month is too cheap. And to run both your servers it wouldnt be good enough

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good VPS
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

[quote=“aekramer, post:1, topic:424329”]Note: I posted this in the stickied thread but didnt get any reply…

Hey all, I am getting a VPS soon (it contains 2 worlds, 317&562), needs to hold like 20-30 people (maybe more), what platform should I pick? Windows, Linux, Unix (I have no clue how they, except windows, work), and is this a good deal: (8USD a month)
VDS 512
512MB RAM
1 VCPU
15GB SAS Storage
1Gbps Port Speed
500GB Included transfer
10 Free IPV6
1 Free IPV4
SolusVM
Semi Managed
Instant Setup
Windows / Linux / Unix[/quote]
You’d need atleast 2GB of ram to run both servers at the same time. You’d also need a CPU speed of like… 3GHz.

Read full topic
